intro: Monnina crotalarioides var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf monnina, is a herbaceous plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or red, arranged in dense spikes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This plant is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or dry environments.
